reviewText: Superior plots, acting and scenery. The wine regions are characters in their own right.
Great French series. My husband and I have enjoyed all three Seasons of Blood of the Vine!
A wonderful French TV series that gets better each year. I'm anxiously awaiting Season 4.
Enjoyed the fact each mystery involved wine. Love countryside.

I love this series.  Everything about it form the scripts, actors, scenery , and the fact that I have learned things about wine and the wine industry is an added bonus. Pierre Arditi is wonderful and I hope I can look forward to more seasons!
A wonderful series which blends geographic coverage of some wine regions of France with well written mystery plots. I hope the series continues.
Just finish watching this season.  On par with the other 2 seasons. Hopefully there will be more.
A very good low key series.

Great stuff ... beautiful scenery, clever plots, good characters and loads of wine.
Recommended for all those reasons.

Never thought that I would enjoy mysteries that force you to read the English subtitles.  But, the shows are so good that after a while you forget that you reading and just become engrossed in the mystery.  Love the beautiful scenery of France's vineyards!

the plot is surprisingly smart and sophisticated. pace is slow relatively to allow for development of characters. besides how can you complain when they shoot on location of the  picturesque french wineries in Bordeaux, Avignon and Alsace?
Excellent Pierre Arditi, we expect for the Blood of the Wine 4. only issue, we cannot remove the subtitles.
Great series!  I totally recommend these--to be watched with a glass (or two) of wine.  The French country side beautiful and the actors wonderful!

Stunningly, stultifyingly boring with the worst pacing of any drama or it's genre.
On the plus side I did manage to catch some quality napping.
To be fair it appears to be my own damned fault for buying season 3, after watching the first and second seasons.
BORING! Sloppy acting. Poor direction. Scenery IS lovely, BUT that is nature not the producers fault.
